title: Limitation of econ. data post war Europe

content.description:
Directions: Each of the questions or incomplete statements below is followed by four suggested answers or completions. Select the one that is best in each case.

The next questions refer to the two tables below.

Table 1: INDUSTRIAL PRODUCTION IN EASTERN EUROPE

(The values are indexed according to each countryâ€™s economic output in 1948. 1948 = 100)

Table 2: GDP PER CAPITA, UNITED STATES DOLLARS, CIRCA 1965
content.question: Which of the following is the most serious potential limitation of the data in the tables for assessing the comparative performance of European economies?

choices.label: In 1938, all Eastern European countries, except for Czechoslovakia, had governments that were more or less authoritarian.
Economic data may have been reported differently in the Eastern Bloc countries than it was in Western European countries.
Since East Germany did not exist as a separate entity before the Second World War, the value of its industrialization index in Table 1 is hypothetical.
Because of the Cold War, both Eastern and Western countries spent significant proportions of their GDP on their military forces.

content.answer: Economic data may have been reported differently in the Eastern Bloc countries than it was in Western European countries.

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Explain the significance of a source's point of view, purpose, historical situation, and/or audience, including how these might limit the use(s) of a source.
